segment.source: App-V 5.0 Security Considerations
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Security Considerations

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Security Considerations
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Security Considerations

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Security Considerations
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Security Considerations

segment.source: This topic contains a brief overview of the accounts and groups, log files, and other security-related considerations for App-V 5.0.
segment.target: This topic contains a brief overview of the accounts and groups, log files, and other security-related considerations for App-V 5.0.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: App-V 5.0 is not a security product and does not provide any guarantees for a secure environment.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 is not a security product and does not provide any guarantees for a secure environment.

segment.source: PackageStoreAccessControl (PSAC) feature has been deprecated
segment.target: PackageStoreAccessControl (PSAC) feature has been deprecated

segment.source: Effective as of June, 2014, the PackageStoreAccessControl (PSAC) feature that was introduced in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 Service Pack 2 (SP2) has been deprecated in both single-user and multi-user environments.
segment.target: Effective as of June, 2014, the PackageStoreAccessControl (PSAC) feature that was introduced in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 Service Pack 2 (SP2) has been deprecated in both single-user and multi-user environments.

segment.source: General security considerations
segment.target: General security considerations

segment.source: Understand the security risks.
segment.target: Understand the security risks.

segment.source: The most serious risk to App-V 5.0 is that its functionality could be hijacked by an unauthorized user who could then reconfigure key data on App-V 5.0 clients.
segment.target: The most serious risk to App-V 5.0 is that its functionality could be hijacked by an unauthorized user who could then reconfigure key data on App-V 5.0 clients.

segment.source: The loss of App-V 5.0 functionality for a short period of time due to a denial-of-service attack would not generally have a catastrophic impact.
segment.target: The loss of App-V 5.0 functionality for a short period of time due to a denial-of-service attack would not generally have a catastrophic impact.

segment.source: Physically secure your computers.
segment.target: Physically secure your computers.

segment.source: Security is incomplete without physical security.
segment.target: Security is incomplete without physical security.

segment.source: Anyone with physical access to an App-V 5.0 server could potentially attack the entire client base.
segment.target: Anyone with physical access to an App-V 5.0 server could potentially attack the entire client base.

segment.source: Any potential physical attacks must be considered high risk and mitigated appropriately.
segment.target: Any potential physical attacks must be considered high risk and mitigated appropriately.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 servers should be stored in a physically secure server room with controlled access.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 servers should be stored in a physically secure server room with controlled access.

segment.source: Secure these computers when administrators are not physically present by having the operating system lock the computer, or by using a secured screen saver.
segment.target: Secure these computers when administrators are not physically present by having the operating system lock the computer, or by using a secured screen saver.

segment.source: Apply the most recent security updates to all computers.
segment.target: Apply the most recent security updates to all computers.

segment.source: To stay informed about the latest updates for operating systems, Microsoft SQL Server, and App-V 5.0, subscribe to the Security Notification service (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=28819).
segment.target: To stay informed about the latest updates for operating systems, Microsoft SQL Server, and App-V 5.0, subscribe to the Security Notification service (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=28819).

segment.source: Use strong passwords or pass phrases.
segment.target: Use strong passwords or pass phrases.

segment.source: Always use strong passwords with 15 or more characters for all App-V 5.0 and App-V 5.0 administrator accounts.
segment.target: Always use strong passwords with 15 or more characters for all App-V 5.0 and App-V 5.0 administrator accounts.

segment.source: Never use blank passwords.
segment.target: Never use blank passwords.

segment.source: For more information about password concepts, see the “Account Passwords and Policies” white paper on TechNet (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=30009).
segment.target: For more information about password concepts, see the “Account Passwords and Policies” white paper on TechNet (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=30009).

segment.source: Accounts and groups in App-V 5.0
segment.target: Accounts and groups in App-V 5.0

segment.source: A best practice for user account management is to create domain global groups and add user accounts to them.
segment.target: A best practice for user account management is to create domain global groups and add user accounts to them.

segment.source: Then, add the domain global accounts to the necessary App-V 5.0 local groups on the App-V 5.0 servers.
segment.target: Then, add the domain global accounts to the necessary App-V 5.0 local groups on the App-V 5.0 servers.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: App-V client computer accounts that need to connect to the publishing server must be part of the publishing server’s Users local group.
segment.target: App-V client computer accounts that need to connect to the publishing server must be part of the publishing server’s Users local group.

segment.source: By default, all computers in the domain are part of the Authorized Users group, which is part of the Users local group.
segment.target: By default, all computers in the domain are part of the Authorized Users group, which is part of the Users local group.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 server security
segment.target: App-V 5.0 server security

segment.source: No groups are created automatically during App-V 5.0 Setup.
segment.target: No groups are created automatically during App-V 5.0 Setup.

segment.source: You should create the following Active Directory Domain Services global groups to manage App-V 5.0 server operations.
segment.target: You should create the following Active Directory Domain Services global groups to manage App-V 5.0 server operations.

segment.source: Group name
segment.target: Group name

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: App-V Management Admin group
segment.target: App-V Management Admin group

segment.source: Used to manage the App-V 5.0 management server.
segment.target: Used to manage the App-V 5.0 management server.

segment.source: This group is created during the App-V 5.0 Management Server installation.
segment.target: This group is created during the App-V 5.0 Management Server installation.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: There is no method to create the group using the management console after you have completed the installation.
segment.target: There is no method to create the group using the management console after you have completed the installation.

segment.source: Database read/write for Management Service account
segment.target: Database read/write for Management Service account

segment.source: Provides read/write access to the management database.
segment.target: Provides read/write access to the management database.

segment.source: This account should be created during the App-V 5.0 management database installation.
segment.target: This account should be created during the App-V 5.0 management database installation.

segment.source: App-V Management Service install admin account
segment.target: App-V Management Service install admin account

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This is only required if management database is being installed separately from the service.
segment.target: This is only required if management database is being installed separately from the service.

segment.source: Provides public access to schema-version table in management database.
segment.target: Provides public access to schema-version table in management database.

segment.source: This account should be created during the App-V 5.0 management database installation.
segment.target: This account should be created during the App-V 5.0 management database installation.

segment.source: App-V Reporting Service install admin account
segment.target: App-V Reporting Service install admin account

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This is only required if reporting database is being installed separately from the service.
segment.target: This is only required if reporting database is being installed separately from the service.

segment.source: Public access to schema-version table in reporting database.
segment.target: Public access to schema-version table in reporting database.

segment.source: This account should be created during the App-V 5.0 reporting database installation.
segment.target: This account should be created during the App-V 5.0 reporting database installation.

segment.source: Consider the following additional information:
segment.target: Consider the following additional information:

segment.source: Access to the package shares - If a share exists on the same computer as the management Server, the Network service requires read access to the share.
segment.target: Access to the package shares - If a share exists on the same computer as the management Server, the Network service requires read access to the share.

segment.source: In addition, each App-V client computer must have read access to the package share.
segment.target: In addition, each App-V client computer must have read access to the package share.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In previous versions of App-V, package share was referred to as content share.
segment.target: In previous versions of App-V, package share was referred to as content share.

segment.source: Registering publishing servers with Management Server - A publishing server must be registered with the Management server.
segment.target: Registering publishing servers with Management Server - A publishing server must be registered with the Management server.

segment.source: For example, it must be added to the database, so that the Publishing server machine accounts are able to call into the Management service API.
segment.target: For example, it must be added to the database, so that the Publishing server machine accounts are able to call into the Management service API.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 package security
segment.target: App-V 5.0 package security

segment.source: The following will help you plan how to ensure that virtualized packages are secure.
segment.target: The following will help you plan how to ensure that virtualized packages are secure.

segment.source: If an application installer applies an access control list (ACL) to a file or directory, then that ACL is not persisted in the package.
segment.target: If an application installer applies an access control list (ACL) to a file or directory, then that ACL is not persisted in the package.

segment.source: When the package is deployed, if the file or directory is modified by a user it will either inherit the ACL in the %userprofile% or inherit the ACL of the target computer’s directory.
segment.target: When the package is deployed, if the file or directory is modified by a user it will either inherit the ACL in the %userprofile% or inherit the ACL of the target computer’s directory.

segment.source: The former case occurs if the file or directory does not exist in a virtual file system location; the latter case occurs if the file or directory exists in a virtual file system location, for example %windir%.
segment.target: The former case occurs if the file or directory does not exist in a virtual file system location; the latter case occurs if the file or directory exists in a virtual file system location, for example %windir%.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 log files
segment.target: App-V 5.0 log files

segment.source: During App-V 5.0 Setup, setup log files are created in the %temp% folder of the installing user.
segment.target: During App-V 5.0 Setup, setup log files are created in the %temp% folder of the installing user.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
